claim.text: The proposed HTML model achieves the highest prediction performance (lowest MSE values) for each of the target time-periods.
claim.exact_quote: The HTML model achieves the highest prediction performance (lowest MSE values) for each of the target time-periods.

evidence.limitations: Comparison is based on a specific dataset and evaluation metric (MSE)
evidence.exact_quote: Table 2: The average n-day volatility prediction errors for our approach (HTML) and the various baselines...

evaluation.justification: The evidence strongly supports the claim, as the HTML model consistently outperforms other baselines across all time-periods.

claim.text: The utility of audio data, and vocal features, in this important financial prediction task, suggests there exists a significant opportunity to explore the use of audio features in a range of related or complementary tasks.
claim.exact_quote: The utility of audio data, and vocal features, in this important financial prediction task, suggests there exists a significant opportunity to explore the use of audio features in a range of related or complementary tasks.

evidence.evidence_text: Previous research [46] has demonstrated the benefits of combining text with audio data, compared to text-only features, in volatility prediction.
evidence.limitations: Based on a single study and a specific task
evidence.location: Section 6.2, On the Utility of Audio Features
evidence.exact_quote: Previous research [46] has demonstrated the benefits of combining text with audio data, compared to text-only features, in volatility prediction.

evidence.evidence_text: HTML delivers its most accurate short-term predictions using text+audio, but its most accurate long-term predictions come from the text-only version.
evidence.limitations: Based on a single experiment and a specific dataset
evidence.location: Section 6.2, On the Utility of Audio Features
evidence.exact_quote: HTML delivers its most accurate short-term predictions using text+audio, but its most accurate long-term predictions come from the text-only version.

evaluation.justification: The evidence suggests that audio features have utility in this task, particularly for short-term predictions, but the conclusion is based on limited evidence.
evaluation.key_limitations: Limited evidence from a single study and experiment

claim.text: The multi-task approach tends to offer improved performance compared to the single-task approach, especially for long-term prediction tasks.
claim.exact_quote: The multi-task approach tends to offer improved performance compared to the single-task approach, especially for long-term prediction tasks.
